intro: Astronia acuminatissima var. subcaudata, commonly known as the narrow-tailed astronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release minute seeds. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
